title: Diagnostics
description: Troubleshoot MDE product issues and collect diagnostics

userActivity.Value: This command provides diagnostic tests for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

backgroundActivity.Value: There are several options to create diagnostic data and upload it to Microsoft.

antivirus-engine-pool-content         Monitor the content for all antivirus engine core pools content
  create                                Generate support log
  real-time-protection-statistics       Display real-time protection resource usage statistics
  event-provider-statistics             Display event provider internal statistics
  behavior-monitoring-statistics        Display behavior monitoring resource usage statistics
  hot-event-sources                     Monitor hot event sources (preview feature)
  ebpf-statistics                       Display ebpf internal statistics
  upload                                Generate and submit support log to Microsoft

userActivity.Value: This command checks the event provider statistics for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

backgroundActivity.Value: Sample Output
Review the counters for various requests and events. High-value counters of process events (fork, exec) may indicate high CPU usage.

userActivity.Value: This command checks the behavior monitoring statistics for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

backgroundActivity.Value: No Sample Output

userActivity.Value: This command checks the hot event sources for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.
We can run this command for both files and executables. It will generate a json file in the current directory with the number of events that occurred while the command ran.
The command will run indefinitely until you stop it with CTRL+C.

backgroundActivity.Value: Sample Output
Sample Output from 'sudo mdatp diagnostic hot-event-sources files'

=========== Hot Event Sources ===========
Top 0 hot event sources. Total Events: 0 Time: 5s. Throughput: 0events/sec
count  file path
Press CTRL+C to stop the command when you have enough data.
We can now view the output from the generated .json file. The file will be named 'hot_event_sources_<GUID>.json'.
cat hot_event_source_1a1767f9-a135-40ec-8286-fc289623d0d4.json
This example ran for 5 seconds and observed no events.
A large number of events may indicate a performance issue.

If eBPF is not enabled, the output will be empty.

userActivity.Value: This command creates and uploads support logs for Microsoft Defender for Endpoint.

backgroundActivity.Value: Sample Output
A zip file is generated in /var/opt/microsoft/mdatp/wdavdiag/ which can be uploaded to a Microsoft support case.
Diagnostic file created: "/var/opt/microsoft/mdatp/wdavdiag/b30d1f0e-8c2b-4107-ae87-5381ff0433a7.zip"
